programme.title: Fighting Fury
programme.desc: A boy raised by his servant vows to take revenge on the ranchers who killed his parents.

programme.title: Sitting Bull
programme.desc: President Grant helps a cavalry major (Dale Robertson) condemned for helping Dakota Chief Sitting Bull (J. Carrol Naish).

programme.title: Fugitive of the Plains
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Buster Crabbe) stages a shootout with outlaws who have transformed an innocent young lady into a wanted desperado.

programme.title: 'Neath Canadian Skies
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) tracks mine robbers in 1890s Canada.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat seeks the killer of a U.S. Postal Inspector.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: The towns people of Bender, Montana take a band of gypsies to court.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate wants to hide the Hooterville Cannonball to save it from the scrap heap.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: The President Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: The railroad president decides to scrap the Cannonball himself.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A phony sheriff is part of a rustling scheme.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho discover the shady motives of a lawyer hired to change a rancher's will.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt enlists the aid of Dakota chiefs to bring in Crazy Horse.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The man behind a string of stagecoach robberies has remained out of reach of company detectives Matt and Frankie, but reinforcements from the city help to crack the case.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Bean appoints himself as the legal guardian of a young man whose father was a member of an outlaw gang; the boy's uncle puts a bounty on his head.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Judge Bean's decisions displease some people, like prohibitionist Dolly Mason; she backs opposing candidate Duke Castle, an outlaw who claims he's reformed.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) looks beyond local gossip to uncover a plot against a struggling family. With Stanley Andrews, Bill Henry.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) attempts to prove a beautiful woman (Eve Miller) is involved in two bank robberies. With Rick Vallin.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: A series of thefts are falsely attributed to the innocent Mingo False Faces.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Hawkeye has tracked outlaw Simon Girty to Morristown but he and Chingachgook are turned away and told that the town is closed due to an outbreak of the black plague; Hawkeye decides to sneak in and see for himself.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: An Easterner swears revenge for the death of his father, a drunk that a Cartwright killed in self-defense.

programme.title: Shine on Harvest Moon
programme.desc: Former partner Milt Brower (William Farnum) and Pa Jackson (Stanley Andrews) are engaged in an embittered land dispute that turns ugly when Jackson accuses Brower of the dastardly crime of cattle rustling.

programme.title: The Cowboy and the Senorita
programme.desc: Two cowboys ride to the rescue when villains try to cheat a teenage girl out of the gold mine she's due to inherit.

programme.title: Billy the Kid Returns
programme.desc: Singing Billy (Roy Rogers) settles a case of mistaken identity with his sidekick, Frog (Smiley Burnette).

programme.title: Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: During the 1889 land rush, a cowboy is accused of staking a claim prior to the official starting time.

programme.title: The Hanged Man
programme.desc: A former gunslinger survives his own hanging and transforms himself into a mysterious avenger of injustice.

programme.title: The Man From Utah
programme.desc: A tough cowboy has a head-to-head confrontation with a gang of outlaws using a rodeo as its base of operations.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: Texas ranchers blame a homeless drifter (John Barrymore Jr.) for two killers' dirty work.

programme.title: The Courageous Avenger
programme.desc: A law officer tries to bring a traitorous mine foreman to justice.

programme.title: Death Valley
programme.desc: When a young man discovers gold, he must deal with threats.

programme.title: The Fighting Redhead
programme.desc: Red Ryder helps his old friend Dan O'Connor in his fight against Faro Savage and his gang of rustlers.
